heroDescription: Discover top-rated financial advisors in Houston, dedicated to helping you achieve your financial goals with tailored strategies.
landscapeDescription: Houston's economy is a broad mix of energy, manufacturing, aeronautics, and healthcare sectors. The city hosts numerous Fortune 500 companies and a thriving financial advisory landscape, featuring a variety of firms specializing in different areas of financial planning.
uniqueNeeds: With a diverse economy and significant wealth disparities, Houston residents require tailored financial planning to navigate energy sector investments and retirement savings.

sections.title: Economic Growth
sections.description: Houston's gross domestic product (GDP) was $490 billion in 2019, making it the fourth-largest economy among metro areas in the U.S. The city's economy expanded by 2.4% in 2019, beating the national growth rate of 2.3%.

sections.title: Wealth Demographics
sections.description: In Houston, the median household income is $51,203. The city is also home to a significant number of high-net-worth individuals. As of 2019, there were 98,000 millionaires, representing around 6.3% of the households in the metropolitan area.

sections.title: Advisor Specializations
sections.description: Given Houston's strong presence in the energy, healthcare, and aerospace sectors, financial advisors in the city often specialize in these areas. This includes investment strategies focused on oil and gas, healthcare real estate, and defense and space.

sections.title: Cost of Living
sections.description: The cost of living in Houston is 2% lower than the national average, according to Payscale. Housing, which accounts for the largest proportion of the cost of living, is 21% cheaper than the national average.

sections.title: Real Estate Market
sections.description: The median home price in Houston is $241,200, slightly above the national median of $231,200. The Houston housing market saw a 5.2% year-over-year increase in 2020, according to Zillow.

sections.title: Business Environment
sections.description: Houston is home to 21 Fortune 500 companies, second only to New York City. The city is a major hub for the energy industry, with more than 5,000 energy firms operating in the region. Houston also has a vibrant startup scene, with over 3,000 tech startups.
